div.a: Chinese Hackers Infiltrate The New York Times, Steal Every Employee's Password

div.div: The timing of the attacks coincided with the reporting for a Times investigation that found that the relatives of China’s prime minister had accumulated a fortune worth several billion dollars through business dealings.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11isvGS&via=Digg&text=Chinese Hackers Infiltrate The New York Times, Steal Every Employee's Password

div.a: Are You Eating What You Think You're Eating?

div.div: Steve Palumbi has a few rules when it comes to sushi. If something is labeled tuna, then it probably is, but stay away from the salmon, because it probably isn’t.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xe8znB&via=Digg&text=Are You Eating What You Think You're Eating?

div.a: Disney's Beautiful Animated Short, 'Paperman,' Debuts Online

div.div: Disney Animation’s "Paperman" has debuted online, giving everyone a chance to look at the Oscar-nominated animated short that blends hand-drawn and computer-generated imagery in a beautiful, innovative way that might just look like the future of animation as a whole.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WyKjOI&via=Digg&text=Disney's Beautiful Animated Short, 'Paperman,' Debuts Online

div.a: These Self-Portraits Of A Fearless Artist Will Make You Uncomfortable

div.div: In some of the South Korean artist's daring photographs, viewers are afforded stomach-churning vertical views of her feet dangling hundreds of feet above the bustling city streets of Seoul, Hong Kong and New York below, or longer shots of her balanced precariously on tower-block parapets

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Yi7sEx&via=Digg&text=These Self-Portraits Of A Fearless Artist Will Make You Uncomfortable

div.a: This Is The Most Extensive Superhero Chart You'll Ever Need

div.div: Issue #2 of the universe's most extensive charting of superpowers. This deluxe Silver Age edition now features over 300 heroes, anti-heros, villains, and beasts.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T7YmuQ&via=Digg&text=This Is The Most Extensive Superhero Chart You'll Ever Need

div.a: Inside The Construction Of New York City's New Subway

div.div: Newly released photos let you see underground construction in progress.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X7YW8h&via=Digg&text=Inside The Construction Of New York City's New Subway

div.div: Russia, China, and the Central Asian states have been busy discovering the virtues of alliance in a common cause. They've been working hard to forge an international front of anti-democrats, developing a new set of counter-strategies and regional legal tools. It seems to be working.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/1185cp0&via=Digg&text=The League Of Authoritarian Gentlemen

div.a: Vancouver Protestors Demand Oprah Stop Endorsing Skin Cream Derived From Baby Foreskin

div.div: The $165 cream in question is SkinMedica, and Oprah has referred to it as her “fountain of youth.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WZ9rL1&via=Digg&text=Vancouver Protestors Demand Oprah Stop Endorsing Skin Cream Derived From Baby Foreskin

div.a: Cocaine Helps Fourth-Grader Win Science Fair

div.div: Maybe it’s just the modern version of the old baking-soda-in-the-volcano project. A Miami fourth-grader, with assistance from her cop dad and three police dogs, used an ounce of cocaine in her science fair project.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11gGYDf&via=Digg&text=Cocaine Helps Fourth-Grader Win Science Fair

div.div: TO GET A HEAD START ON YOUR WALK OF SHAME

div.a: Why You Always Wake Up Early After A Night Of Drinking

div.div: Lots of people have a little booze before bed to help them get to sleep — but while a night cap may help in the dozing-off department, too much alcohol can actually do a number on the overall quality of your shuteye.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11gJKsl&via=Digg&text=Why You Always Wake Up Early After A Night Of Drinking

div.div: AND WHY WE'RE TERRIBLE AT FAKING THEM

The neuronal signals for smiles usually start in the cortex of our brain. From there they travel to the deeper part, the brainstem -- which, in terms of evolution, also happens to be one of the oldest parts of our brain.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14v1pkd&via=Digg&text=How Smiles Control Us All

div.a: Entire Gangnam Style Video Drawn By Hand

div.div: Artist etoilec1 drew the Gangnam Style video, the entire thing, and presented it as a flipbook.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Yj5gg8&via=Digg&text=Entire Gangnam Style Video Drawn By Hand

div.div: In October 2011, a Facebook engineer named Cory Ondrejka stood in front of Mark Zuckerberg, his CEO. Using a white board to illustrate his points, Ondrejka told Zuckerberg that Facebook was broken in a big, scary way and that he, a relatively new engineer at the company, had the solution.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VsoIqb&via=Digg&text=This Engineer Saved Facebook

div.a: How Disney Got J.J. Abrams To Do 'Star Wars'

div.div: An inside look at how Kathleen Kennedy got J.J. Abrams to sign on to direct "Star Wars Episode VII."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TWO9mJ&via=Digg&text=How Disney Got J.J. Abrams To Do 'Star Wars'

div.div: HEMLOCK MAKES A GREAT GIRLS NAME THOUGH

div.a: The Most Poisoned Baby Name In U.S. History

div.div: Hillary Clinton is more popular than ever — but her name isn't. In 1992, when Bill Clinton first entered office, Hillary and its variations plummeted in popularity. The name had been poisoned; mothers abandoned it at record speed. Statistician Hilary Parker examines the anti-Hillary trend.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UDWtpg&via=Digg&text=The Most Poisoned Baby Name In U.S. History

div.a: The Human Race Will Come To An End. What's Next?

div.div: Given evolution’s trajectory, we will almost certainly transform into augmented versions of our current selves. The big question now is, can we survive long enough to become the next humans?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XSAUPs&via=Digg&text=The Human Race Will Come To An End. What's Next?

div.div: CUTTING PONYTAILS IS RIM'S FAT LADY SINGING

div.a: Blackberry Announces The End Of Blackberry

div.div: Today's BlackBerry 10 event wasn't a product launch. It was a funeral.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YiFkBj&via=Digg&text=Blackberry Announces The End Of Blackberry

div.div: A MILLION WAYS TO SAY EX-BOYFRIEND

div.a: How Facebook Taught Its Search Tool To Understand People

div.div: Facebook this month introduced a search tool to help users find answers to many kinds of questions. But before it did, it assembled an eclectic team to scrutinize what users were searching for on the site — and how.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WtYKUL&via=Digg&text=How Facebook Taught Its Search Tool To Understand People

div.div: YOU COULD AFFORD A TICKET IN 1967

div.a: How Much More Do Things Cost Today: The Super Bowl Edition

div.div: This column is dedicated to taking some element of life that we all take for granted and examining how its cost has changed over time, as adjusted for inflation. This week we're ready for some football. Specifically, let's look at the cost of running those television commercials, then the cost for the tickets to the actual event itself.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wy5dxC&via=Digg&text=How Much More Do Things Cost Today: The Super Bowl Edition

div.div: MORE OF A SPREADSHEET KIND OF HOLIDAY

div.a: Please Do Not Make A Valentine's Day PowerPoint Presentation

div.div: There is a lot of stuff more romantic than hearing your creepy weirdo boyfriend read out loud to you some dumb letter he wrote, and that's especially true when it's being read via an audio file set to accompany a PowerPoint presentation.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VX1ZT1&via=Digg&text=Please Do Not Make A Valentine's Day PowerPoint Presentation

div.a: Japan's Female Olympic Judo Athletes Say Coaches Beat Them

div.div: A group of judokas complained to the Japanese Olympic Committee (JOC) last month that they had been subjected to physical punishment by the team’s head coach, Ryuji Sonoda.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/128yWkK&via=Digg&text=Japan's Female Olympic Judo Athletes Say Coaches Beat Them

div.a: 'Cannibal Cop' Jurors Will Need To Be Cool With Cannibalism Porn

div.div: The jury selection process for the upcoming trial of alleged "cannibal cop" Gilberto Valle is going to be a gas.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X8wFi0&via=Digg&text='Cannibal Cop' Jurors Will Need To Be Cool With Cannibalism Porn

div.a: Where Is The Most Plastic Surgery Performed?

div.div: More people than ever are turning to the knife or the needle in the hope of physical perfection. Over 14.7m tucks, peels, jabs and lifts were performed by licensed plastic surgeons in 2011.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wxt9kI&via=Digg&text=Where Is The Most Plastic Surgery Performed?

div.a: Which Sport's Athletes Are The Best?

div.div: The thought experiment is to compare players across sports. I.e., are basketball players better at basketball than, say, snooker players are at playing snooker?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Yihkhs&via=Digg&text=Which Sport's Athletes Are The Best?

div.a: The Many Epic Smackdowns Of Donald Trump

div.div: Donald Trump sure can take a verbal punch.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11eELgu&via=Digg&text=The Many Epic Smackdowns Of Donald Trump

div.a: Infinite Street View Takes You On A Tour As Far As Google's Eye Can See

div.div: Infinite Street View, created by web developer Noah Veltman, takes you beyond Google Maps to explore unending glimpses of a specified area.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XjeyHO&via=Digg&text=Infinite Street View Takes You On A Tour As Far As Google's Eye Can See

div.a: How Londoners Got Word Of The Plague

div.div: The plague was abroad. Londoners knew not where it had come from, only that it was upon Holland.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X87eNn&via=Digg&text=How Londoners Got Word Of The Plague

div.div: COME FOR THE NEWS, LEAVE FOR THE SNARK
The social sharing tool was once a vision. Now it's a prison.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WvOPxv&via=Digg&text=Why I Hate Twitter

div.div: SEARCHING FOR THE GRAIN OF TRUTH

A slanted post about the quinoa craze set off a cascade of reproachful media warnings last week, telling consumers that by eating the grain-like vegetable they are hurting people in the Andean region where most of it is grown.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WWmcaT&via=Digg&text=Quinoa Controversy Redux

div.a: Photographer Captures Stunning Footage Of Silhouettes In Front Of A Rising Moon

div.div: People had gathered up there this night to get the best view possible of the moon rising. I captured the video from 2.1km away on the other side of the city.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TXrDdt&via=Digg&text=Photographer Captures Stunning Footage Of Silhouettes In Front Of A Rising Moon

div.a: Pepper Spray Camera Will Take A Snapshot Of Your Mugger

div.div: This is a can of pepper spray that blinds your attacker, takes a snapshot of them, and calls the police for you at the push of a button.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WrlWCx&via=Digg&text=Pepper Spray Camera Will Take A Snapshot Of Your Mugger

div.a: NASA Is Still Trying To Figure Out This Whole IT Security Thing

div.div: A NASA contractor shares a very short blurb on how incompetent NASA's IT security is.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X7Ulmx&via=Digg&text=NASA Is Still Trying To Figure Out This Whole IT Security Thing

div.div: BLACKBERRY IS DEAD, LONG LIVE BLACKBERRY
New phones. New software. And a new company name. An exclusive look at the difficult road that led to the most important day in the company's troubled history.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X87SL4&via=Digg&text=Inside Blackberry's Last Stand

div.a: The Kraken Awakes: What Architeuthis Is Trying To Tell Us

div.div: Captured live on video in its deep-sea element, for the first time, the Kraken of tall tales and sea shanties—Architeuthis, the giant squid—is coming into sharp focus, a flesh-and-blood reality. But why now?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SZHGpo&via=Digg&text=The Kraken Awakes: What Architeuthis Is Trying To Tell Us
